intro: Cynophalla declinata, commonly known as the bent-stemmed corymbiferous plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to southern Africa, where it typically grows in grassland and rocky habitats. The plant is characterized by its slender, often sprawling stems and clusters of small, pea-like flowers. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. Cynophalla declinata is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food and shelter for various insects and small animals.
